article.headline: Vermont 72, Marist 62
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. -- Marqus Blakely had 23 points and 11 rebounds for his sixth double-double of the season as Vermont rallied to defeat winless Marist 72-62 on Monday night. The Catamounts (8-5) trailed 42-35 with 17:16 left, then used a 17-2 run over the next 9:39 to take the lead for good. Blakely, who scored seven points in the spurt, finished 8-for-10 from the floor and 7-for-9 from the line with four steals and two blocks. The Red Foxes (0-10) made it a four-point game on a free throw by Daye Kaba with 2:30 left, but Maurice Joseph answered with a 3-pointer for Vermont. The Catamounts, who have won five straight on the road, trailed 37-31 at halftime after making only three of their last 17 shots from the field. Marist, which was averaging 54.9 percent from the free throw line, made 9 of 10 foul shots in the first half. Candon Rusin led the Red Foxes with 16 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
